intro: Oxytropis thessala, commonly known as Greek Locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, and it is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils. Oxytropis thessala is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and steppe environments.
